meanings.definition: A small bundle or cluster, especially of nerve or muscle fibers.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the fascicle of nerves in the diagram.
meanings.sent2: She held a fascicle of flowers in her hand.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored a fascicle of acorns in its nest for winter.
meanings.sent4: The fascicle of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The child carefully collected a fascicle of colorful leaves for her art project.

meanings.definition: A section of a book or manuscript, typically bound separately.
meanings.sent1: The library had a rare fascicle of the ancient manuscript on display.
meanings.sent2: He found the missing fascicle of the encyclopedia on the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally dropped a fascicle of papers during class.
meanings.sent4: The final fascicle of the novel revealed the surprising plot twist.
meanings.sent5: She eagerly awaited the next fascicle of the magazine to continue reading the story.
